## Skills measured as of November 7, 2025
### Audience profile
This exam is targeted to you, if you’re looking to familiarize yourself with the fundamentals of security, compliance, and identity (SCI) across cloud-based and related Microsoft services.
If you have an interest in Microsoft SCI solutions, this exam is for you, whether you’re a:
1. Business stakeholder
2. New or existing IT professional
3. Student
You should be familiar with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365 and want to understand how Microsoft SCI solutions can span across these solution areas to provide a holistic and end-to-end solution.
### Skills at a glance
1. Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity (10–15%)
2. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra (25–30%)
3. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft security solutions (35–40%)
4. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft compliance solutions (20–25%)
### Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity (10–15%)
#### Describe security and compliance concepts
1. Describe the shared responsibility model
2. Describe defense-in-depth
3. Describe the Zero Trust model
4. Describe encryption and hashing
5. Describe Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) concepts
#### Define identity concepts
1. Define identity as the primary security perimeter
2. Define authentication
3. Define authorization
4. Describe identity providers
5. Describe the concept of directory services and Active Directory
6. Describe the concept of federation
### Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra (25–30%)
#### Describe function and identity types of Microsoft Entra ID

2. Describe types of identities
3. Describe hybrid identity
#### Describe authentication capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID
1. Describe the authentication methods
2. Describe multifactor authentication (MFA)
3. Describe password protection and management capabilities
#### Describe access management capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID
1. Describe Conditional Access

### Describe the capabilities of Microsoft security solutions (35–40%)

2. Describe Azure Firewall
3. Describe Web Application Firewall (WAF)
4. Describe network segmentation with Azure virtual networks
5. [Security](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=security&resource_type=learning%20path)

Learn about core concepts that are foundational to security, compliance, and identity solutions, including shared responsibility, Zero Trust, data residency, the role of identity providers, and more.

Here are all the learning paths in preparation for the SC-900 exam: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals.

Part 1: Introduction to security, compliance, and identity concepts

[Part 2: Introduction to Microsoft Entra](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-identity-access/)

[Part 3: Introduction to Microsoft security solutions](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-security-solutions/)

[Part 4: Introduction to Microsoft Priva and Microsoft Purview](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-compliance-solutions/)

If you're new to the security area, we recommend:

Primer: [Describe the concepts of cybersecurity](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-basic-concepts-of-cybersecurity/)

## Prerequisites

- None

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?icid=msft_learn)

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Describe security and compliance concepts](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-security-concepts-methodologies/)

Learn about common security and compliance concepts that are foundational to Microsoft solutions. Topics include the shared responsibility and Zero Trust models, encryption, data residency and data sovereignty, and more.

[Describe identity concepts](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-identity-principles-concepts/)

Learn about the key concepts of authentication and authorization and why identity is important in securing corporate resources. You'll also learn about some identity-related services.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-concepts-of-security-compliance-identity/"},{"title":"Introduction to Microsoft security solutions - Training","content":"# Introduction to Microsoft security solutions

- Learning Path
- 5 Modules

##  At a glance

- Level 

[Beginner](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?levels=beginner&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure&resource_type=learning%20path)[Microsoft 365](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=m365&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Business User](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=business-user&resource_type=learning%20path)[Student](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=student&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Security](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=security&resource_type=learning%20path)

Learn about security capabilities in Microsoft. Topics covered will include network and platform capabilities of Azure, Azure security management, and Sentinel. You’ll learn about threat protection with Microsoft Defender XDR and Microsoft 365 security management.

Here are all the learning paths in preparation for the SC-900 exam: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals.

[Part 1: Introduction to security, compliance, and identity concepts](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-concepts-of-security-compliance-identity/)

[Part 2: Introduction to Microsoft Entra](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-identity-access/)

Part 3: Introduction to Microsoft security solutions

[Part 4: Introduction to Microsoft Priva and Microsoft Purview](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-compliance-solutions/)

If you are new to the security area, we recommend:

Primer: [Describe the concepts of cybersecurity](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-basic-concepts-of-cybersecurity/)

## Prerequisites

- General understanding of networking and cloud computing concepts.
- General IT knowledge or any general experience working in an IT environment.
- General understanding of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?icid=msft_learn)

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Describe Microsoft Security Copilot](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/security-copilot-getting-started/)

Get acquainted with Microsoft Security Copilot. You are introduced to some basic terminology, how Microsoft Security Copilot processes prompts, the elements of an effective prompt, and how to enable the solution.

[Describe core infrastructure security services in Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-basic-security-capabilities-azure/)

Learn about capabilities Azure supports to protect your network, VMs, and your data.

[Describe the security management capabilities in Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-security-management-capabilities-of-azure/)

Learn about Microsoft Defender for Cloud and the capabilities it brings together to protect your cloud through secure score, recommendations, and enhanced features that provide cloud workload protection.

[Describe security capabilities of Microsoft Sentinel](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-security-capabilities-of-azure-sentinel/)

Learn about Microsoft Sentinel a scalable, cloud-native, security information event management (SIEM) and security orchestration automated response (SOAR) solution. In this module, you’ll also be introduced to Microsoft Security Copilot.

[Describe threat protection with Microsoft Defender XDR](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-threat-protection-with-microsoft-365-defender/)

Protect against cyber threats with Microsoft Defender XDR across endpoints, identities, email, and applications.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-security-solutions/"},{"title":"Prepare to teach SC-900 Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals in academic programs - Training","content":"# Prepare to teach SC-900 Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals in academic programs

- Learning Path
- 8 Modules

##  At a glance

- Level 

[Beginner](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?levels=beginner&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Microsoft Defender for Cloud](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=defender-for-cloud&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Higher Education Educator](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=higher-ed-educator&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Compliance](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=compliance&resource_type=learning%20path)[Identity and access](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=identity-access&resource_type=learning%20path)[Security](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=security&resource_type=learning%20path)

The Microsoft Learn for Educators program provides eligible educators and faculty members at colleges, universities, community colleges, polytechnics, and some STEM-focused secondary schools access to Microsoft's ready-to-teach curriculum and teaching materials aligned to industry-recognized Microsoft Certifications.

## Prerequisites

- None

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Introduction to Microsoft Learn for Educators program](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-learn-educators-program/)

Microsoft Learn for Educators provides eligible educators and faculty members at colleges, universities, community colleges, polytechnics, and some STEM-focused secondary schools access to Microsoft's ready-to-teach curriculum and teaching materials aligned to industry-recognized Microsoft certifications.

[Onboard to Microsoft Learn for Educators program](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/onboard-microsoft-learn-educators-program/)

Joining MSLE, getting certified in the content you'll be teaching, integrating Microsoft Official Course materials, and leveraging the various benefits will help ensure your students are well prepared for today’s job opportunities.

[Microsoft Learn for Educators Course Preparation](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/microsoft-learn-educators-course-preparation/)

Your students want skills that make them employable. Using the resources available from Microsoft will help you feel confident to teach your students the skills they need to help them pass a Microsoft Certification exam.

[Microsoft Learn for Educators course planning](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/microsoft-learn-educators-course-plan/)

As you prepare for your course delivery, begin by determining the curriculum integration approach, implementation plan, LMS integration of Microsoft Learn benefits, and student reporting. Provide clarity about certification and employability success to your students.

[Learn best practices from Microsoft Technical Trainers](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/learn-best-practices-from-microsoft-technical-trainers/)

Utilizing tips and tricks from Microsoft technical trainers, including creating a digitally diverse learning community with bias-free communication and inclusive design methodology by accommodating students' diverse needs, can help your students succeed.

[Get tips and tricks for teaching SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/get-tips-tricks-teach-sc-900-security-compliance-identity-fundamentals/)

Learn tips and tricks about preparing for your first teaching session, which labs to use, when and how to introduce technical topics, as well as other resources and materials.

[Microsoft Learn for Educators preparing for course delivery](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/prepare-for-course-delivery/)

Use the resources available from Microsoft to prepare to teach your course and feel confident you're providing your students the skills they need skills to be successful across various in-demand technical careers.

[Microsoft Learn for Educators student certification](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/close-out-course/)

Use the resources available from Microsoft to prepare to teach your course and feel confident you're providing your students the skills they need skills to pass a Microsoft Certification exam.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/prepare-teach-sc-900-academic-programs/"},{"title":"Microsoft Fundamentals","content":"# Microsoft Fundamentals
## Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals
This course provides you with a broad introduction to the fundamentals of security, compliance, and identity (SCI) across cloud-based and Microsoft services. Designed for students who are already familiar with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365, this course covers core concepts, principles, and methodologies that are foundational to security, compliance, and identity solutions, including Zero-Trust, shared responsibility, our privacy principles, and more. You'll also learn about identity and access management in the Microsoft Cloud along with compliance solutions. Completion of the course prepares students for the [SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/exams/sc-900) certification exam and can be used to prepare, but isn't a prerequisite for other [SCI role-based certifications](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/browse/?resource_type=certification&products=azure%2Cm365&terms=SC-&expanded=azure%2Cm365).
Students may be eligible for ACE college credit if they pass this certification exam. See [ACE college credit for certification exams](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/college-credit) for details.
## Dynamics 365 Fundamentals (CRM)
This course provides you with a broad introduction to the customer engagement capabilities of Dynamics 365. You'll become familiar with the concept of customer engagement, as well as each of the customer engagement apps, including Dynamics 365 Marketing, Dynamics 365 Sales, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Field Service, and the customer relationship management (CRM) capabilities of Dynamics 365 Project Operations. This course will include lecture as well as interactive labs. Completion of the course prepares students for the [MB-910: Dynamics Fundamentals (CRM)](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/exams/mb-910) certification exam.
Students may be eligible for ACE college credit if they pass this certification exam. See [ACE college credit for certification exams](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/college-credit) for details.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/educator-center/programs/msle/fundamentals#microsoft-security,-compliance,-and-identity-fundamentals"},{"title":"Study guide for Exam SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals","content":"# Study guide for Exam SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals

# Study guide for Exam SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals
## Skills measured as of November 7, 2025
### Audience profile
This exam is targeted to you, if you’re looking to familiarize yourself with the fundamentals of security, compliance, and identity (SCI) across cloud-based and related Microsoft services.
If you have an interest in Microsoft SCI solutions, this exam is for you, whether you’re a:
1. Business stakeholder
2. New or existing IT professional
3. Student
You should be familiar with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365 and want to understand how Microsoft SCI solutions can span across these solution areas to provide a holistic and end-to-end solution.
### Skills at a glance
1. Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity (10–15%)
2. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra (25–30%)
3. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft security solutions (35–40%)
4. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft compliance solutions (20–25%)
### Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity (10–15%)
#### Describe security and compliance concepts
1. Describe the shared responsibility model
2. Describe defense-in-depth
3. Describe the Zero Trust model
4. Describe encryption and hashing
5. Describe Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) concepts
#### Define identity concepts
1. Define identity as the primary security perimeter
2. Define authentication
3. Define authorization
4. Describe identity providers
5. Describe the concept of directory services and Active Directory
6. Describe the concept of federation
### Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra (25–30%)
#### Describe function and identity types of Microsoft Entra ID
1. Describe Microsoft Entra ID
2. Describe types of identities
3. Describe hybrid identity
#### Describe authentication capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID
1. Describe the authentication methods
2. Describe multifactor authentication (MFA)
3. Describe password protection and management capabilities
#### Describe access management capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID
1. Describe Conditional Access
2. Describe Microsoft Entra roles and role-based access control (RBAC)
#### Describe identity protection and governance capabilities of Microsoft Entra
1. Describe Microsoft Entra ID Governance
2. Describe access reviews
3. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra Privileged Identity Management
4. Describe Microsoft Entra ID Protection
### Describe the capabilities of Microsoft security solutions (35–40%)
#### Describe core infrastructure security services in Azure
1. Describe Azure distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) Protection
2. Describe Azure Firewall
3. Describe Web Application Firewall (WAF)
4. Describe network segmentation with Azure virtual networks
5. Describe network security groups (NSGs)

# Study guide for Exam SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals
## Updates to the exam
Our exams are updated periodically to reflect skills that are required to perform a role. We have included two versions of the Skills Measured objectives depending on when you are taking the exam.
We always update the English language version of the exam first. Some exams are localized into other languages, and those are updated approximately eight weeks after the English version is updated. While Microsoft makes every effort to update localized versions as noted, there may be times when the localized versions of an exam are not updated on this schedule. Other available languages are listed in the **Schedule Exam** section of the **Exam Details** webpage. If the exam isn't available in your preferred language, you can request an additional 30 minutes to complete the exam.
#### Note
The bullets that follow each of the skills measured are intended to illustrate how we are assessing that skill. Related topics may be covered in the exam.
#### Note
Most questions cover features that are general availability (GA). The exam may contain questions on Preview features if those features are commonly used.

Would you like to request an achievement code?

[Describe security and compliance concepts](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-security-concepts-methodologies/)

Learn about the key concepts of authentication and authorization and why identity is important in securing corporate resources. You'll also learn about some identity-related services.

##  At a glance

- Level

- Subject 

[Security](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=security&resource_type=learning%20path)

Learn about security capabilities in Microsoft. Topics covered will include network and platform capabilities of Azure, Azure security management, and Sentinel. You’ll learn about threat protection with Microsoft Defender XDR and Microsoft 365 security management.

Here are all the learning paths in preparation for the SC-900 exam: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals.

[Part 1: Introduction to security, compliance, and identity concepts](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-concepts-of-security-compliance-identity/)

[Part 2: Introduction to Microsoft Entra](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-identity-access/)

Part 3: Introduction to Microsoft security solutions

[Part 4: Introduction to Microsoft Priva and Microsoft Purview](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-compliance-solutions/)

If you are new to the security area, we recommend:

Primer: [Describe the concepts of cybersecurity](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-basic-concepts-of-cybersecurity/)

## Prerequisites

- General understanding of networking and cloud computing concepts.
- General IT knowledge or any general experience working in an IT environment.
- General understanding of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?icid=msft_learn)

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Describe Microsoft Security Copilot](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/security-copilot-getting-started/)

Get acquainted with Microsoft Security Copilot. You are introduced to some basic terminology, how Microsoft Security Copilot processes prompts, the elements of an effective prompt, and how to enable the solution.

[Describe core infrastructure security services in Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-basic-security-capabilities-azure/)

Learn about capabilities Azure supports to protect your network, VMs, and your data.

[Describe the security management capabilities in Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-security-management-capabilities-of-azure/)

Learn about Microsoft Defender for Cloud and the capabilities it brings together to protect your cloud through secure score, recommendations, and enhanced features that provide cloud workload protection.

[Describe security capabilities of Microsoft Sentinel](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-security-capabilities-of-azure-sentinel/)

Learn about Microsoft Sentinel a scalable, cloud-native, security information event management (SIEM) and security orchestration automated response (SOAR) solution. In this module, you’ll also be introduced to Microsoft Security Copilot.

[Describe threat protection with Microsoft Defender XDR](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-threat-protection-with-microsoft-365-defender/)

Protect against cyber threats with Microsoft Defender XDR across endpoints, identities, email, and applications.

results.title: Microsoft Fundamentals
results.content:
# Microsoft Fundamentals
## Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals
This course provides you with a broad introduction to the fundamentals of security, compliance, and identity (SCI) across cloud-based and Microsoft services. Designed for students who are already familiar with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365, this course covers core concepts, principles, and methodologies that are foundational to security, compliance, and identity solutions, including Zero-Trust, shared responsibility, our privacy principles, and more. You'll also learn about identity and access management in the Microsoft Cloud along with compliance solutions. Completion of the course prepares students for the [SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/exams/sc-900) certification exam and can be used to prepare, but isn't a prerequisite for other [SCI role-based certifications](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/browse/?resource_type=certification&products=azure%2Cm365&terms=SC-&expanded=azure%2Cm365).
Students may be eligible for ACE college credit if they pass this certification exam. See [ACE college credit for certification exams](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/college-credit) for details.
## Dynamics 365 Fundamentals (CRM)
This course provides you with a broad introduction to the customer engagement capabilities of Dynamics 365. You'll become familiar with the concept of customer engagement, as well as each of the customer engagement apps, including Dynamics 365 Marketing, Dynamics 365 Sales, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Field Service, and the customer relationship management (CRM) capabilities of Dynamics 365 Project Operations. This course will include lecture as well as interactive labs. Completion of the course prepares students for the [MB-910: Dynamics Fundamentals (CRM)](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/exams/mb-910) certification exam.
Students may be eligible for ACE college credit if they pass this certification exam. See [ACE college credit for certification exams](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/college-credit) for details.

You even extend Dynamics 365 solutions using Power Platform components, such as Power Automate and Power Apps.

As a candidate for this certification, you should have subject matter expertise in building database solutions that are designed to support multiple workloads built with:

  • SQL Server on-premises
  • Azure SQL services

You’re a database administrator who manages on-premises and cloud databases built with SQL Server and Azure SQL services.

As the Azure database administrator, you implement and manage the operational aspects of cloud-native and hybrid data platform solutions built on SQL Server and Azure SQL services. You use a variety of methods and tools to perform and automate day-to-day operations, including applying knowledge of using Transact-SQL (T-SQL) and other tools for administrative management purposes.

You’re responsible for the following concerning database solutions:

  • Management
  • Availability
  • Security
  • Performance monitoring and optimization

You evaluate and implement migration strategies for moving databases between Azure and on-premises. Plus, you work with Azure data engineers, Azure solution architects, Azure developers, data scientists, and other professionals to manage operational aspects of data platform solutions.

As a candidate for this certification, you should have knowledge of and experience with:

  • Azure SQL Database
  • Azure SQL Managed Instance
  • SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines (Windows and Linux)

Important

The English language version of this certification will be updated on June 18, 2025. Review the study guide linked in the Certification resources section for details about upcoming changes.

result.text:
![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-the-concepts-of-security-compliance-and-identity.svg)

# Introduction to security, compliance, and identity concepts

- Learning Path
- 2 Modules

## At a glance

- Level 

[Beginner](/en-us/training/browse/?levels=beginner&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Microsoft Entra ID](/en-us/training/browse/?products=entra-id&resource_type=learning%20path)[Azure](/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure&resource_type=learning%20path)[Microsoft 365](/en-us/training/browse/?products=m365&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Business User](/en-us/training/browse/?roles=business-user&resource_type=learning%20path)[Student](/en-us/training/browse/?roles=student&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Security](/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=security&resource_type=learning%20path)

Learn about core concepts that are foundational to security, compliance, and identity solutions, including shared responsibility, Zero Trust, data residency, the role of identity providers, and more.

Here are all the learning paths in preparation for the SC-900 exam: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals.

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-the-concepts-of-security-compliance-and-identity.svg)

Part 1: Introduction to security, compliance, and identity concepts

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-identity-access-management-solutions.svg)

[Part 2: Introduction to Microsoft Entra](../describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-identity-access/)

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the capabilities of Microsoft security solutions learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-the-capabilities-of-microsoft-security-solutions.svg)

[Part 3: Introduction to Microsoft security solutions](../describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-security-solutions/)

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the capabilities of Microsoft compliance solutions learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-the-capabilities-of-microsoft-compliance-solutions.svg)

[Part 4: Introduction to Microsoft Priva and Microsoft Purview](../describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-compliance-solutions/)

If you're new to the security area, we recommend:

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the basic concepts of cybersecurity learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/cybersecurity-basic-concepts.svg)

Primer: [Describe the concepts of cybersecurity](../describe-basic-concepts-of-cybersecurity/)

## Prerequisites

- None

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?cid=msft_learn)

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-security-concepts-and-methodologies.svg)](../../modules/describe-security-concepts-methodologies/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-security-concepts-and-methodologies.svg)

[Describe security and compliance concepts](../../modules/describe-security-concepts-methodologies/)

Learn about common security and compliance concepts that are foundational to Microsoft solutions. Topics include the shared responsibility and Zero Trust models, encryption, data residency and data sovereignty, and more.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-identity-principles-and-concepts.svg)](../../modules/describe-identity-principles-concepts/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-identity-principles-and-concepts.svg)

[Describe identity concepts](../../modules/describe-identity-principles-concepts/)

Learn about the key concepts of authentication and authorization and why identity is important in securing corporate resources. You'll also learn about some identity-related services.

Start

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-the-capabilities-of-microsoft-security-solutions.svg)

# Introduction to Microsoft security solutions

- Learning Path
- 5 Modules

## At a glance

- Level 

[Beginner](/en-us/training/browse/?levels=beginner&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure](/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure&resource_type=learning%20path)[Microsoft 365](/en-us/training/browse/?products=m365&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Business User](/en-us/training/browse/?roles=business-user&resource_type=learning%20path)[Student](/en-us/training/browse/?roles=student&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Security](/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=security&resource_type=learning%20path)

Learn about security capabilities in Microsoft. Topics covered will include network and platform capabilities of Azure, Azure security management, and Sentinel. You’ll learn about threat protection with Microsoft Defender XDR and Microsoft 365 security management.

Here are all the learning paths in preparation for the SC-900 exam: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals.

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-the-concepts-of-security-compliance-and-identity.svg)

[Part 1: Introduction to security, compliance, and identity concepts](../describe-concepts-of-security-compliance-identity/)

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-identity-access-management-solutions.svg)

[Part 2: Introduction to Microsoft Entra](../describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-identity-access/)

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the capabilities of Microsoft security solutions learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-the-capabilities-of-microsoft-security-solutions.svg)

Part 3: Introduction to Microsoft security solutions

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the capabilities of Microsoft compliance solutions learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-the-capabilities-of-microsoft-compliance-solutions.svg)

[Part 4: Introduction to Microsoft Priva and Microsoft Purview](../describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-compliance-solutions/)

If you are new to the security area, we recommend:

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the basic concepts of cybersecurity learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/cybersecurity-basic-concepts.svg)

Primer: [Describe the concepts of cybersecurity](../describe-basic-concepts-of-cybersecurity/)

## Prerequisites

- General understanding of networking and cloud computing concepts.
- General IT knowledge or any general experience working in an IT environment.
- General understanding of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?cid=msft_learn)

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[![](/en-us/learn/achievements/security-copilot-getting-started.svg)](../../modules/security-copilot-getting-started/)

![](/en-us/learn/achievements/security-copilot-getting-started.svg)

[Describe Microsoft Security Copilot](../../modules/security-copilot-getting-started/)

Get acquainted with Microsoft Security Copilot. You're introduced to some basic terminology, how Microsoft Security Copilot processes prompts, the elements of an effective prompt, and how to enable the solution.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-basic-security-capabilities-in-azure.svg)](../../modules/describe-basic-security-capabilities-azure/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-basic-security-capabilities-in-azure.svg)

[Describe core infrastructure security services in Azure](../../modules/describe-basic-security-capabilities-azure/)

Learn about capabilities Azure supports to protect your network, VMs, and your data.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-security-management-capabilities-of-azure.svg)](../../modules/describe-security-management-capabilities-of-azure/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-security-management-capabilities-of-azure.svg)

[Describe the security management capabilities in Azure](../../modules/describe-security-management-capabilities-of-azure/)

Learn about Microsoft Defender for Cloud and the capabilities it brings together to protect your cloud through secure score, recommendations, and enhanced features that provide cloud workload protection.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-security-capabilities-of-azure-sentinel.svg)](../../modules/describe-security-capabilities-of-azure-sentinel/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-security-capabilities-of-azure-sentinel.svg)

[Describe security capabilities of Microsoft Sentinel](../../modules/describe-security-capabilities-of-azure-sentinel/)

Learn about Microsoft Sentinel a scalable, cloud-native, security information event management (SIEM), and security orchestration automated response (SOAR) solution. In this module, you’ll also be introduced to Microsoft Security Copilot.

Microsoft Entra ID is Microsoft’s cloud-based identity and access management solution that connects people to their apps, devices, and data. Learn about the functions and identity types supported by Microsoft Entra ID.

Learn about the authentication capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID, including multifactor authentication, and how they improve security. You'll also learn about self-service password reset (SSPR) and the password protection and management capabilities.

Microsoft Entra provides identity protection and governance capabilities. ## Skills measured as of November 7, 2025
### Audience profile
This exam is targeted to you, if you’re looking to familiarize yourself with the fundamentals of security, compliance, and identity (SCI) across cloud-based and related Microsoft services.
If you have an interest in Microsoft SCI solutions, this exam is for you, whether you’re a:
1. Business stakeholder
2. New or existing IT professional
3. Student
You should be familiar with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365 and want to understand how Microsoft SCI solutions can span across these solution areas to provide a holistic and end-to-end solution.
### Skills at a glance
1. Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity (10–15%)
2. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra (25–30%)
3. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft security solutions (35–40%)
4. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft compliance solutions (20–25%)
### Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity (10–15%)
#### Describe security and compliance concepts
1. Describe the shared responsibility model
2. Describe defense-in-depth
3. Describe the Zero Trust model
4. Describe encryption and hashing
5. Describe Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) concepts
#### Define identity concepts

2. Define authentication
3. Define authorization
4. Describe identity providers
5. Describe the concept of directory services and Active Directory
6. Describe the concept of federation
### Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra (25–30%)
#### Describe function and identity types of Microsoft Entra ID

2. Describe types of identities
3. Describe hybrid identity

1. Describe the authentication methods
2. Describe multifactor authentication (MFA)
3. Describe password protection and management capabilities
#### Describe access management capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID

### Describe the capabilities of Microsoft security solutions (35–40%)

5. # Introduction to Microsoft Entra

- Learning Path
- 4 Modules

##  At a glance

- Level 

[Beginner](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?levels=beginner&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Microsoft Entra ID](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=entra-id&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Business User](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=business-user&resource_type=learning%20path)[Student](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=student&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Compliance](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=compliance&resource_type=learning%20path)[Identity and access](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=identity-access&resource_type=learning%20path)[Security](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=security&resource_type=learning%20path)

Microsoft Entra ID is Microsoft's cloud-based identity and access management solution. Learn about Microsoft Entra services and identity principals, secure authentication, access management capabilities, as well as identity protection and governance.

Here are all the learning paths in preparation for the SC-900 exam: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals.

[Part 1: Introduction to security, compliance, and identity concepts](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-concepts-of-security-compliance-identity/)

Part 2: Introduction to Microsoft Entra

[Part 3: Introduction to Microsoft security solutions](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-security-solutions/)

[Part 4: Introduction to Microsoft Priva and Microsoft Purview](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-compliance-solutions/)

If you're new to the security area, we recommend:

Primer: [Describe the concepts of cybersecurity](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-basic-concepts-of-cybersecurity/)

## Prerequisites

- General understanding of networking and cloud computing concepts.
- General IT knowledge or any general experience working in an IT environment.
- General understanding of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Describe the function and identity types of Microsoft Entra ID](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/explore-basic-services-identity-types/)

Microsoft Entra ID is Microsoft’s cloud-based identity and access management solution that connects people to their apps, devices, and data. Learn about the functions and identity types supported by Microsoft Entra ID.

[Describe the authentication capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/explore-authentication-capabilities/)

Learn about the authentication capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID, including multifactor authentication, and how they improve security. You'll also learn about self-service password reset (SSPR) and the password protection and management capabilities.

[Describe access management capabilities of Microsoft Entra](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/explore-access-management-capabilities/)

A key function of Microsoft Entra is to manage access. Learn about Microsoft's Security Service Edge (SSE) solution, conditional access, and how Microsoft Entra roles and role-based access control (RBAC) help organizations manage access.

[Describe the identity protection and governance capabilities of Microsoft Entra](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-identity-protection-governance-capabilities/)

Microsoft Entra provides identity protection and governance capabilities. Learn about these capabilities, the use cases, and benefits.

results.title: Study guide for Exam SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals
results.content:
# Study guide for Exam SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals
## Skills measured as of November 7, 2025
### Audience profile
This exam is targeted to you, if you’re looking to familiarize yourself with the fundamentals of security, compliance, and identity (SCI) across cloud-based and related Microsoft services.
If you have an interest in Microsoft SCI solutions, this exam is for you, whether you’re a:
1. Business stakeholder
2. New or existing IT professional
3. Student
You should be familiar with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365 and want to understand how Microsoft SCI solutions can span across these solution areas to provide a holistic and end-to-end solution.
### Skills at a glance
1. Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity (10–15%)
2. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra (25–30%)
3. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft security solutions (35–40%)
4. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft compliance solutions (20–25%)
### Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity (10–15%)
#### Describe security and compliance concepts
1. Describe the shared responsibility model
2. Describe defense-in-depth
3. Describe the Zero Trust model
4. Describe encryption and hashing
5. Describe Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) concepts
#### Define identity concepts
1. Define identity as the primary security perimeter
2. Define authentication
3. Define authorization
4. Describe identity providers
5. Describe the concept of directory services and Active Directory
6. Describe the concept of federation
### Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra (25–30%)
#### Describe function and identity types of Microsoft Entra ID
1. Describe Microsoft Entra ID
2. Describe types of identities
3. Describe hybrid identity
#### Describe authentication capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID
1. Describe the authentication methods
2. Describe multifactor authentication (MFA)
3. Describe password protection and management capabilities
#### Describe access management capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID
1. Describe Conditional Access
2. Describe Microsoft Entra roles and role-based access control (RBAC)
#### Describe identity protection and governance capabilities of Microsoft Entra
1. Describe Microsoft Entra ID Governance
2. Describe access reviews
3. Describe the capabilities of Microsoft Entra Privileged Identity Management
4. Describe Microsoft Entra ID Protection
### Describe the capabilities of Microsoft security solutions (35–40%)
#### Describe core infrastructure security services in Azure
1. Describe Azure distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) Protection
2. Describe Azure Firewall
3. Describe Web Application Firewall (WAF)
4. Describe network segmentation with Azure virtual networks
5. Describe network security groups (NSGs)

[Security](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=security&resource_type=learning%20path)

Learn about security capabilities in Microsoft. Topics covered will include network and platform capabilities of Azure, Azure security management, and Sentinel. You’ll learn about threat protection with Microsoft Defender XDR and Microsoft 365 security management.

Here are all the learning paths in preparation for the SC-900 exam: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals.

[Part 1: Introduction to security, compliance, and identity concepts](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-concepts-of-security-compliance-identity/)

[Part 2: Introduction to Microsoft Entra](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-identity-access/)

Part 3: Introduction to Microsoft security solutions

Primer: [Describe the concepts of cybersecurity](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/describe-basic-concepts-of-cybersecurity/)

## Prerequisites

- General understanding of networking and cloud computing concepts.
- General IT knowledge or any general experience working in an IT environment.
- General understanding of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?icid=msft_learn)

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Describe Microsoft Security Copilot](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/security-copilot-getting-started/)

Get acquainted with Microsoft Security Copilot. You are introduced to some basic terminology, how Microsoft Security Copilot processes prompts, the elements of an effective prompt, and how to enable the solution.

[Describe core infrastructure security services in Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-basic-security-capabilities-azure/)

Learn about capabilities Azure supports to protect your network, VMs, and your data.

[Describe the security management capabilities in Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-security-management-capabilities-of-azure/)

Learn about Microsoft Defender for Cloud and the capabilities it brings together to protect your cloud through secure score, recommendations, and enhanced features that provide cloud workload protection.

[Describe security capabilities of Microsoft Sentinel](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-security-capabilities-of-azure-sentinel/)

Learn about Microsoft Sentinel a scalable, cloud-native, security information event management (SIEM) and security orchestration automated response (SOAR) solution. In this module, you’ll also be introduced to Microsoft Security Copilot.

[Describe threat protection with Microsoft Defender XDR](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-threat-protection-with-microsoft-365-defender/)

Protect against cyber threats with Microsoft Defender XDR across endpoints, identities, email, and applications.

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the concepts of security, compliance, and identity learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-the-concepts-of-security-compliance-and-identity.svg)

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the capabilities of Microsoft compliance solutions learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-the-capabilities-of-microsoft-compliance-solutions.svg)

[Part 4: Introduction to Microsoft Priva and Microsoft Purview](../describe-capabilities-of-microsoft-compliance-solutions/)

If you're new to the security area, we recommend:

![Screenshot of the trophy for the Describe the basic concepts of cybersecurity learning path.](/en-us/training/achievements/cybersecurity-basic-concepts.svg)

Primer: [Describe the concepts of cybersecurity](../describe-basic-concepts-of-cybersecurity/)

## Prerequisites

- General understanding of networking and cloud computing concepts.
- General IT knowledge or any general experience working in an IT environment.
- General understanding of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.

## Modules in this learning path

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/explore-basic-services-identity-types-azure-active-directory.svg)](../../modules/explore-basic-services-identity-types/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/explore-basic-services-identity-types-azure-active-directory.svg)

[Describe the function and identity types of Microsoft Entra ID](../../modules/explore-basic-services-identity-types/)

Microsoft Entra ID is Microsoft’s cloud-based identity and access management solution that connects people to their apps, devices, and data. Learn about the functions and identity types supported by Microsoft Entra ID.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/explore-the-authentication-capabilities-of-azure-ad.svg)](../../modules/explore-authentication-capabilities/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/explore-the-authentication-capabilities-of-azure-ad.svg)

[Describe the authentication capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID](../../modules/explore-authentication-capabilities/)

Learn about the authentication capabilities of Microsoft Entra ID, including multifactor authentication, and how they improve security. You'll also learn about self-service password reset (SSPR) and the password protection and management capabilities.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/explore-the-access-management-capabilities-of-azure-ad.svg)](../../modules/explore-access-management-capabilities/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/explore-the-access-management-capabilities-of-azure-ad.svg)

[Describe access management capabilities of Microsoft Entra](../../modules/explore-access-management-capabilities/)

A key function of Microsoft Entra is to manage access. Learn about Microsoft's Security Service Edge (SSE) solution, conditional access, and how Microsoft Entra roles and role-based access control (RBAC) help organizations manage access.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-identity-protection-governance-capabilities-azure-ad.svg)](../../modules/describe-identity-protection-governance-capabilities/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-identity-protection-governance-capabilities-azure-ad.svg)

[Describe the identity protection and governance capabilities of Microsoft Entra](../../modules/describe-identity-protection-governance-capabilities/)

Microsoft Entra provides identity protection and governance capabilities. Learn about these capabilities, the use cases, and benefits.
